author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...CENTER OF BERYL MOVING INLAND OVER THE YUCATAN PENINSULA... ...DANGEROUS HURRICANE-FORCE WINDS, STORM SURGE, AND DAMAGING WAVES EXPECTED IN THE LANDFALL AREA THIS MORNING...
summary:
...CENTER OF BERYL MOVING INLAND OVER THE YUCATAN PENINSULA... ...DANGEROUS HURRICANE-FORCE WINDS, STORM SURGE, AND DAMAGING WAVES EXPECTED IN THE LANDFALL AREA THIS MORNING...
 As of 7:00 AM CDT Fri Jul 5
 the center of Beryl was located near 20.4, -87.6
 with movement WNW at 15 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 980 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 100 mph.
